39354869.review:
[h1]This version of "Little Red Riding Hood" is something you have not seen before![/h1]

I can't tell if [i]RED[/i] is an RPG Maker game or not given the gameplay...yet given the interface and stock music, it feels just like it was made in RPG Maker...yet the gameplay is nothing like any RPG Maker game I've ever played!!!

[i]RED[/i] is a re-written version of a classic old story with new twists that you can guess through the introduction.  This time, it turns out that the girl and the wolf are the good guys and the grandmother is the bad guy.  Several unique factors make [i]RED[/i] stand out from its source material.  For instance, the protagonists are 3 separate personalities in 1 character...a human girl (with her mother's shotgun), a wolf girl (with her bare claws), and a hybrid girl (with her father's scythe).

Now...the important factors, this game IS short and if speedrun on easy, it should take you about 7 minutes....though playing on Normal may take you about 30-40 minutes (I hate that bridge...).  There ARE in-game achievements, but no Steam achievements...making the achievement factor rather meaningless.  It is also important to note that it is not possible to take snapshots given that Steam Overlay does not work with this game, further evidence that points to this game being made in RPG Maker.

The artwork of this game...is simply awesome.  I love it!  Characters are well-animated and look great, as does the background scenery.  The feel of the character's personality feel genuine and engaging.  The designs for all the characters are great as well, ranging from charming to sexy!  How this game was released for free is beyond me, but I commend this 3-person development team of Chinese college students for their project.  Well done!  Well done, indeed!

If I have any complaints about this game, it is that this game is rather button-mashy and it's rather difficult to dodge mid-run on the bridge, making control really confusing and cumbersome.  There are a few typos here and there (English), but it's not anything that makes the game unplayable or any less enjoyable.  This game is also tragically short, but it will keep you occupied for an hour or less.

Overall, I loved this game and highly urge other players to take a look into [i]RED[/i] if they're looking for a game to try out.  Achievement hunters will find themselves sorely disappointed by the achievement feature, but casual gamers will enjoy this new take on an old story.  A good lesson in the class of "achievements aren't everything".

9.5 / 10  This game's making me see [i]RED[/i] and I LOVE IT!!!

39185377.review:
RED is a very interesting game. It has a lot of potential. However... It's too short! It's only about 30 minutes to beat on average! Even Extreme mode only took me about 40 minutes! Anyway, some spoilers ahead, so if you don't wanna see that... Come on, it doesn't take that long to just look at the direction the thumb is pointing. If you're OK with that, read on.

First off I gotta say, this game looks gorgeous. The hand-drawn animation looks great, although it feels a little stiff at some spots, but it's very minor, and I can let it slide. The bright red that pops up often looks great against the dark green and brown background. Every hit looks satisfying.

This game has a very interesting mechanic that allows you to switch between Red's three personalities - the default personality, Red, who wields a scythe, Vermillion, who has a shotgun and a motherfucking cannon, and my favorite, Camellia, the wolf-anthro-human-thingamajig. She doesn't have a weapon, instead fighting with her claws. Each of the three characters have their own health bar, but that's not really used outside of bosses, because...

The game is pretty easy. Died twice on normal mode, both times thinking I had to dodge the boar on the bridge. Didn't die once in hard. I only had trouble in extreme difficulty, specifically in the mirror boss fight, where I died around six times, and at the final boss, I think I only died twice. You may have noticed that I have only talked about bosses. That's because the stages that aren't bosses are a cakewalk - I'm sure you actually have to put effort to lose those. Every other enemy leaves a health pickup. And those small enemies die really quickly, probably three or four hits will take any of them out.

The story itself isn't exactly mindblowing, but it's a cute little thing that put a smile on my face on my second playthrough. Beat the game yet? Told ya it was short. Anyway, the reason I specified the second playthrough, is because when you get the normal ending, the game gives you a hint - more like gives you exactly what you need to know - to get the best ending. It isn't subtle at all, but I'm happy it's simple and doesn't ask you to crouch next to a a random wall for like half a minute without pressing anything else. (Looking at you, Castlevania 2!) It's a very minor change, but it's adorable. When I saw what was happening, I thought I was going to be depressed for the rest of the day - glad I wasn't.

The controls are good. A bit stiff with the jump arcs, but it's nothing major. It may be the engine holding it back, half the time. Oh yeah this game is made in RPG Maker and that's just mindblowing. I, err, may have used the dodge/block button way more than I actually needed to. I just like blocking hits perfectly. It also allows you to counter hits easier, so yeah, that's pretty useful if you ask me. It bugs me that there's no evident controller support, but if it makes it any easier for you guys who are used to WASD movement, you CAN rebind keys! Personally, I set my controls to WASD to move, K to attack, J for special attacks, L for blocking, and 1, 2, and 3 to change into Red, Vermillion, and Camellia respectively. Now, the reason I said Camellia was my favorite earlier... She's fast as all hell. Seriously. I love how fast her attacks can get, and her aerial special attack is a spike, straight from Smash Bros. I love it.

Each of the different personalities have their own health bars, which means if you're running low on health with one, you better be either: 1. Really good at blocking perfectly. 2. Switching to another personality right this second, 'cuz that's not automatic. I feel there may be some inspiration from fighting games like Marvel vs. Capcom 2 (that one's the only one I actually played so SHHHHH), but I like that it's actually tied into the story how the one character can swap into another in the press of a button without changing her position at all. You aren't just shown the three personalities working together, you experience it firsthand. And it makes the true ending that much sweeter.

Buuut, I'm pretty sure I'm dragging this out WAY longer than I should. The game has potential. I would love to see something like this, but expanded. And in another engine. I've heard RPG Maker is pretty... Limiting. As in, it's only made to play a specific goddamn genre. I still can't believe this game, well, exists. Like this.

TL;DR 8.4/10 Too good, too short

38712341.review:
[h1]No spoilers inside[/h1]

I pretty much completed the game on the highest difficulty, only 4 achievements remaining that i'll try and get eventually.
So, I'll tell you about this fine game without any spoilers.

This is a fun sidescrolling action game made by students.
You might want to treat this one as a boss-only kind of game, since everything else is a little bit lacking.

But, and a big BUT, this game is good enough to have your attention!

__________________________

Negative stuff, let's see...

- [b][One of the achievements?][/b]
Can't really think of anything negative other than a single achievement that will make you start the game over and over until you get it (i didn't get it, tried three times and called it a day).
This isn't a game-breaking thing or anything that will make you enjoy the game any less, but it can be frustrating to speedrun through the game just to have another try at it.

Well, that's it about the negativeness.

____________________

Positive stuff.

+ [b][Story][/b] The feelings are there, they don't destroy your hearts, but they are there.
The prologue is well done. Even tho the story is based on Red Riding Hood, it is unique enough on it's own.
The main antagonist can be pretty straightforward, but you'll get to feel quite a few emotions through this little story.
And that's what a good story is about, making you feel emotions while entertaining you.

+ [b][Soundtrack][/b] I enjoyed 3 of the songs a lot.
As the game progresses, the soundtrack gets better and better. Not something i would listen for years, but it matches the game and the story pretty well.

+ [b][Difficulty/Reward][/b] 4 Difficulties available.
I started the game on extreme, just to see how many times i would bite the dust. I died around 20 or 30 times in total, which is a nice number for me (i mean, i'm no god at action games, but i did have to stop mashing buttons and do my best to try and learn the game in order to win).
You do get a little reward for your troubles. I won't spoil you in any way, but it feels like a "thank you for being serious about it".

+ [b][Combos][/b]
They are and feel good enough for the game to have a Practice mode. You might have to practice a bit if you want to complete the game.
I just wish there we could perform combos while using swaps, [strike]pretty much like in Bloody Roar[/strike]. I get the feeling that the game would feel much more adrenaline inducing with that.

______________

Regular stuff.

X [b][Bosses][/b]
Enough quantity of bosses, and enough uniqueness to them. However, the strategy behind beating them on the highest difficulty may be a bit cheesy.

X [b][Controls][/b]
The movements outside of combat is a bit clunky, but the gameplay is balanced in combat due to the combos, animation-cancelling and the swapping.

X [b][Camera while running][/b]
It feels cropped at times, but it isn't that big of an issue.

[h1]𝑬𝒔𝒕𝒆 𝒆𝒔 𝒎𝒊 𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒎𝒆𝒓 𝒂𝒏á𝒍𝒊𝒔𝒊𝒔 𝒂𝒍 𝒅𝒆𝒕𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒆, 𝒄𝒖𝒂𝒍𝒒𝒖𝒊𝒆𝒓 𝒆𝒓𝒓𝒐𝒓 𝒒𝒖𝒆 𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒖𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒓𝒆𝒔 𝒔𝒆 𝒂𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒄𝒆 𝒑𝒓𝒐𝒇𝒖𝒏𝒅𝒂𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒆 𝒒𝒖𝒆 𝒍𝒐 𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝒆𝒏 𝒍𝒐𝒔 𝒄𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒓𝒊𝒐𝒔.[/h1]

RED es, literalmente, un diminuto RPG creado por tres estudiantes de universidad empleando Flash y RPG Maker (lo cual me impresiona porque nunca he visto un juego Side-Scrolling 2D mediante el empleo de ese motor de juego).

Gracias a un tal Adrián Palomino del Moral  podemos disfrutar esta corta experiencia traducida al español.

La temática del juego trata de una chica que "posee 3 personalidades", la cual recibe una carta por parte de su abuela diciendo que desea verla, por lo que cruzará un peligroso bosque en su busca.


[b]DESCRIPCIÓN DE LAS PROTAGONISTAS[/b]

Ellas se hacen llamar Red, Camellia y Vermillion. 
[list]

[*]Red es la forma principal, se caracteriza por ser mitad humana, mitad licántropo (al mismo tiempo, es decir, orejas y cola de lobo pero forma humana), 
[*]Camellia por otra parte es más parecida a su padre, por lo que la licantropía predomina en su forma. 
[*]Por último, Vermillion la podríamos considerar totalmente humana, pues físicamente es así.
[/list]
[b]PUNTOS POSITIVOS[/b]
[list]
[*]Controles simples y totalmente configurables (únicamente desde el menú principal, una vez dentro del juego no se puede alterar nada)

[*]Pese a su corta duración (en cuanto a historia), el juego dispone de varias dificultades, logros y un modo desafío para que le dediques algo más de tiempo. Los combos son escasos pero útiles en combate.

[*]El tutorial es sencillo y práctico.
[/list]
[b]PUNTOS NEGATIVOS[/b]
[list]
[*]La duración del juego sería el principal punto negativo, en comparación a lo que el juego ofrece, pues si lees con detenimiento la introducción y te lo tomas con calma, el juego dura media hora (aunque es fácilmente repetible).

[*]Si quieres que el juego funcione debes excluirlo del DEP de Windows, si no, el juego no iniciará. (pronto publicaré una guía corta para solucionar el problema).

30222344.review:
Another free-to-play game that makes me appreciate having been born in such era. It is a fairly well-made 2D side-scroller with decent combat system, touching story, neat designs, and good music.

The combat system, while it feels a bit stiff, provides 3 different styles you can choose to your liking, features smooth combo chains that can be combined with special skills, and provides guard/dodge mechanics that enriches the battle experience.

The story, although the game is overall short, is surprisingly quite emotional with enough character development to make you like them.

The designs are pretty neat and cute to the point where people wouldn't likely think that this game is free-to-play just from the visuals. The main characters, bosses, and mobs are all uniquely designed and well-animated.

The music are unexpectedly dramatic, have a good variety, and are beautifully set up for different scenes to really amplify the players' immersion to the story.

Therefore, RED is definitely quite a well-designed game overall that will likely impress you how solid and decent of an experience free-to-play content can offer.

30072238.review:
Allright im going to try my best to keep this spoiler free, but that might be a little hard becuase it's a really short game.

First of i would like to say the game is far from perfect, but that doesnt mean its anthing but good. I rather enjoyed the  several 20-30 minute play throughs i did, and i believe there is alot of potential in this game, if it continues to get updates and more content.

Throughout the game you will encounter different flaws such as the translations not being fully acurate, and maybe even a little cheesy and quite weird at some points. The combos can be a bit clunky at times. While there is a little variety, theres just not quite enough to make it a more fluent experience. However that could also just be me being crap at this sort of game. I also think they could have put a bit more effort in the characters names, and by this im not realy talking about the main character Red, i mean others that are in the story, more notably green and brown. Also there is no voice acting, but that isnt so important in this type of game i would assume.

Ok so that's basicly all the flaws i found with the game, except for the menu and lack of settings, but thats kind of expected in this type of game. Now lets get into some stuff i think are going well with the game.

You play as Red. A unique character that i think is a very strong point in this game. She shares her body with two other personalities, vermilion, and Camellia. They both have their own unique combat style and looks, and personalities.

While the story is a very simple go from point A to point B, it actualy still has a pretty deep story jammed into the 20-30 minutes. You will find out the backstory of your own character and even several others. You will also come across several different monsters that all look magnificent, and bosses with their own attack patterns.

The game looks amazing with stunning environments filled filled different plants, and various things to find by pressing the space bar( This is how you unlock the 2nd ending, you have to find a specific item).

The sounds in the game are well put in, including the music. I didn't feel that it was so repetitive that i would want to turn of the sound. Like many other games out there.

While there is no steam acheivments, and the developer has stated there are no plans to add them, there is acheivments in the actual game. The achievment option will appear in the main menu along with the challange mode after finishing the game for the first time. The challange mode is basicly just vsing the bosses over, while they are scaled in difficulty, and speaking of difficulty, there are several options to choose from. Easy,Normal,Hard,Extreame. I only managed to play on normal, and i found it pretty easy. But as soon as i turned it up to hard, i couldnt even beat the first boss, so there is deffinetly difference in what you pick.

So overall i think the game has potential and i would like to see more of it. The secret ending wasnt so good for me, becuase of how it handles the main characters. But that doesnt spoil it for it for me, it was stil entertaining.

This is my first review so it's probably not done right, but oh well. Aslo theres probably alot of mistakes made in this.

29813962.review:
Well I just downloaded to pass the time and I have no regrets. The story explains why things are happening and its nothing so deeper, the characters are simply and the controls as well. 
In general, this is a funny and simple game. This game is short, but incredibly charming for what it has. the combat system was very well developed and the main 3 characters that you could switch between all had in-depth and well thought out combos and abilities. the bosses were also nicely made, even the boar at the beginning had rather interesting attacks and every character had a style i could really appreciate. I also found the story to be really cute and endearing. as for the developers i'd have to tell them great job and to keep up the hard work. A short, but very good game. 

At first, when i saw they are going to do a real-time fighting game in RPGMaker, i thought: "it's gonna be slow due to custom scripts, that's what always happen". But they managed to optimize it to such degree that on Windows 7 it runs smoothly and without any frame drops. Moreover, it's a real fighting, with combos, move interruption, combo counter, etc.

29484644.review:
鬼畜难度通关后来写测评。游戏设定很有意思（小红帽果然是可萌可帅气的实用人物），其实这是披着ACT外套的格斗游戏吧！
音乐很赞，画风也很不错。流程特别短，打的快通关非常快，不过因为是免费游戏嘛。初上手的话会觉得人物攻击生硬，但是在会连段之后就不会感到生硬了。
因为系统比较简单，所以连段的取消链也很容易，所以连段很好打出来。
但是有一个东西非常不友好，那就是练习模式，居然不是打木桩，而是和一个困难的BOSS打，直接导致想进去练连段却被一直胖揍。
这里说几个常用连段（没错，是我在被BOSS欧打半天后摸索出来的）
镰刀
Z起手（建议防反然后Z）:ZZ 6Z ZZ 6Z ZZ 6Z ZZ 2Z JZ J2Z JX(必杀)  
6Z起手（在镜面小红用地面必杀的时候防了镰刀转回来的那一hit伤害的瞬间6Z必中）：6Z ZZ 6Z  X 6Z 2Z JZ J2Z JX
枪炮暂时没研究，本人爱好近战。
兽形态
特别无脑，就是ZZZZZZZZZZ就能连起来
还有就是ZZZ ZZZ X ZZZ JX
建议多用瞬防打防反不然高难度会死的很难看。
BOSS打法：
猪BOSS，用镰刀理论上可以ZZ6Z LOOP赖死它，但是容易断。猪跳到天上的时候注意听音效，差不多了就多按防御。
镜子，老老实实打防反，不要想别的。镰刀就瞬防了Z后马上接Z连段。枪炮请注意瞬防了6Z后再接Z反击，如果觉得自己防了枪炮的JZ可以反击就会死的很难看，兽人基本防了Z和6Z都能反。
魔女，多用瞬防拉位移，拉到魔女身边后打她，如果自己脚下有闪电的白圈就不要攻击老实防御，因为闪电可以打断你。魔女放地面拱起来岩石的技能的时候可以6Z往前推然后开始连，这个时候那个石头戳不到你。魔女的蓝色波一次6发，防了最后一发接Z连段。防了魔女大招可以无压力接连段。
变形魔女：虽然看起来是霸体，其实并不是霸体，所以连段打上去是有硬直的。两种必杀，一个前面两个脚蓄力戳一下，瞬防后确反。一个尾巴戳11下，注意11下后最后接的那一下无法防御，请加方向键跳躲。然后往前走路戳你，一共是6下，瞬防最后一下后确反。放球的时候请拉防。如果被弹开了就用防御拉距离拉到BOSS面前就行了。
总体来说是个值得一玩的好游戏，很赞。
顺便附上自己打的录像：
http://www.bilibili.com/video/av8222532/index_2.html

A short, but very good game. 

At first, when i saw they are going to do a real-time fighting game in RPGMaker, i thought: "it's gonna be slow due to custom scripts, that's what always happen". Story is predictable, but nice anyway. English translation contains affordable amount of mistakes, it never took me more than 10s to figure out what they meant.

Overall 9/10.
